dataList.content: After spending some time battling gnomes and trashing the gift factory...
... we soon realized that the 'gifts' the conveyor belts were moving weren't your average gifts.
Is that... a foot? Is that a sign with the drawing of a foot? What's that doing there?
This one... is adorned with a depiction of an eyeball.
These gifts appear to be made from materials that do not normally go into building these items.
Their shapes are of teddy bears. Oil pastel boxes. Toy trains...
But they have an abnormally high concentration of protein and phosphorous.
However, the decorations and the lights are made of proper materials. They must have salvaged the wastes expelled from the City.
It's obvious. G.M.F.H.
Gifts made from humans...
Haah... more stuff made from human sacrifice? I guess the Outskirts isn't so different from the City, huh?
What's really concerning is... who are these gifts for?
Who... in their right mind would want anything like these?
Who knows. Rich folks with screwed-up perversions? Maybe that's who they're for.
Uh... so...
If they're making gifts out of people... Heathcliff and Don Quixote... will the gnomes turn them into gifts, too?
<... I do recall them saying something about... locally produced materials...?!>
Then we must move with haste.
I have discovered a location with a high probability of their presence. Presuming that they haven't been turned into gifts yet.
After a long silence, Meursault spoke up. He pointed in a direction.
There. The placard says 'Gift Assembly'.
